Adv. Energy Mater. 2017, 7, 1602545
arcs at lower frequencies and straight sloped lines at higher frequencies. The feature of the RC in parallel is also revealed by the proposed models of equivalent circuits of published results. Usually, the components of the electrolyte resistance (Rs), charge transfer resistance (Rct), and Warburg impedance (W) are typical components to be shown in Figure 14. Furthermore, the RC in parallel circuit of Rct and CPE (constant phase-angle element, as known as the double layer impedance[226]) plays a significant role in the electrode since the charge transfer resistance and the electron double layer capacitance are dominating parts during the surface faradic reaction. From the comparison of the two curves in Figure 14, the dramatic reduction of the value of Rct measured through the decreasing diameter of the semicircle arcs in Figure 14 is the major reason of the enhanced performance of samples.[226] According to a recent report, (Fei et al.[103]), hierarchical starfish-like V2O5 nanostructures (Liang et al.[143]), V2O5–graphene nanocomposites (Chen et al.[186]), and dodecahedron-shaped porous V2O5–carbon composite (Zhang et al.[180]), the regulation was a key factor in enhancement of the electrochemical performance. The reduction of Rct can usually be ascribed to the hierarchical or porous morphology of the as-fabricated samples, better ion diffusion efficiency due to the improved surface area, and the usage of the additive with higher electric conductivity. An eventual purpose of the enhancement of the V2O5 and V2O5-based composite electrodes is to reduce the value of Rct with the maintenance of the stability and reliability of the electrochemical system.
In general, the characterization of electrodes using EIS plots is quite essential. The EIS result can bring better and more comprehensive understanding of the mechanism of the faradic reaction in the electrolyte-interface-electrode microsystem, which is beneficial to the novel design of electrodes to improve their electrochemical performance.

sections.heading: 7. Summary
sections.text:
A critical review and statistical analysis of published data were conducted in this paper. Due to the unique lamellar crystalline
structure composed of layers of VO5 distorted pyramids, the interlayered space provided for the intercalation of lithium ions is desirable. A significant property of V2O5 is the successive transformation of phases from the pristine V2O5 to lithium-intercalated LixV2O5 with different x value ranges, i.e., α-LixV2O5 (0 < x < 0.01); ε-LixV2O5 (0.35 < x < 0.7); δ-LixV2O5 (0.7 < x < 1); γ-LixV2O5 (1 < x < 2); ω-LixV2O5 (2 < x < 3). Different equilibrium potentials of these phase transformation as well as lithium ion intercalation reactions are beneficial for researchers to manipulate the number of inserted lithium ions. Results of one, two, and three lithium ions inserted are discovered individually. For the case of one lithium ion inserted, the typical specific capacity was 130–147 mA h g–1; the specific capacity of LIB cells could roughly reach to 260–294 mA h g–1 when two lithium ions are inserted; if there are three lithium ions get intercalated, a performance of more than 360 mA h g–1 could be attained with the upper limit of 441 mA h g–1. These three insertion modes could be tuned by applying different potential windows of charge/discharge cycles. Among three lithium ion insertion modes, two lithium ions insertion exhibited the highest occupancy as 43.5%. This implied that the insertion of two lithium ions was utilized most commonly for the LIB electrodes. This phenomenon could be ascribed that the mode of two lithium ions insertion had the highest theo retical specific capacity (294 mA h g–1) for performance stability. Even though the insertion mode of three intercalated lithium ions had the largest theoretical specific capacity of 441 mA h g–1, it however lacked of the capacity stability. This was due to the irreversible formation of phase ω if three lithium ions get inserted. While, with the emerging of the novel structures such as porous, ultrathin, and hierarchical nano-architectures synthesized by different routes, this conventional obstacle was under the process of gradually being overcome. Several work which had successful attempts to get excellent cyclic performance, i.e., the capacity fading per cycle were not greater than 0.5%,[75,89,150,151] proved the reliability of the strategy of developing new structures.
Data analysis was conducted based on two plots. One is the current density versus maximum specific capacity and the other is the cycle number versus and capacity fading per cycle, as shown in Figures 10 and 11. Two unprecedented concepts of the “high capacity bands” and “the empirical total capacity retention in percentage (kR)” were proposed. The “high capacity band” implied that the preferred interval of the measured current density to reach higher maximum specific capacity has the boundary from exp(µ – σ) to exp(µ + σ). For hierarchical and unhierarchical electrodes, their corresponding boundaries of the “high capacity bands” are found following the band boundary, i.e., 30–500 mA g–1. The electrochemical performance was expected to be optimized if the applied current density was within this range. The parameter of the “empirical total capacity retention” belonged to the mode of one lithium ion insertion. This could be attributed to the result of the fewest times of LixV2O5 phase transformations owned by one inserted lithium ion. This could reduce the passive effect such as the permanent formation of new phases and the consequent severe volume expansion/extraction after applying numerous charge/discharge cycles.
In this review, it was found that utilization of the active additive micro- and nano-materials resulted in the improvement
www.advenergymat.de
© 2017 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim1602545 (27 of 32)
www.advancedsciencenews.com
Adv. Energy Mater. 2017, 7, 1602545
of the electrochemical performance of V2O5 as LIB electrodes. The category of the additives spans from carbonaceous to polymeric materials. The enhancement of the electrochemical performance by adding such active additives is obvious. Based on the review, the first enhancement was the smaller current density such that most of the composite electrodes could reach the optimal specific capacity around 294 mA h g–1 than that of V2O5 electrodes. The second was the increased empirical capacity retentions kR of composite electrodes. The two improvement could be attributed to two main reasons: (1) for the additives of carbonaceous and conductive polymeric materials, the net electrical conductivity could be improved due to their high conductivity; (2) for the additives of transition metal compounds, the synergistic effect between the V2O5 matrix and the additives could raise the total reaction rates and efficiency.
Besides the components and the insertion modes, the selection of the synthesis routes can affect the properties and electrochemical performance of electrode as well. Most reported work used the means of hydrothermal or solvothermal routes to prepare samples. There are five reported advantages using the hydrothermal/solvothermal routes: the ease of the experimental steps; the flexibility of the manipulation of the concentration of reagents and the reaction temperature and the time length; the reliability of the crystalline structure of as-prepared samples; the stability of the reaction condition in enclosed vessel; and the uniformity of the dispersion of prepared nano- or microparticles without massive agglomeration. Furthermore, other representative synthesis methods of electrospinning, electrodeposition, among others, were also used as typical means to prepare V2O5 and V2O5-based composite electrodes.
The application of EIS benefited researchers to investigate the faradic reaction mechanism and the diffusion/transport behavior nearby the electrolyte/electrode liquid-solid interface. The analysis of Nyquist plot of EIS results suggested the reduced charge transfer resistance (Rct) played the most significant role to enhance the electrochemical performance of both V2O5 and V2O5-based composite electrodes. This reduction could be observed through the decreased diameter of the semicircle arcs in Nyquist plot. Usually, the reduction of the value of Rct was the result of the enhanced charge transfer rate as well as the improved reaction kinetics, which were crucial to improve the electrochemical performance of electrodes.

sections.heading: 8. Outlook
sections.text:
In recent years, the emergence of the hierarchical structures in micro- and nano-scale due to the utilization of innovative synthesis methods has changed the conventional and exclusive usage of bulk powders as electrodes of batteries. The hierarchical structure has the features of numerous pores included in different scales, well-organized morphology of complex appearance, and the interconnecting of the adjacent parts.[11,39,129,241,242,243–245] The better electrochemical performance of the aligned hierarchical architectures and relevant reasons have been reviewed critically elsewhere.[39] According to our analysis, the structure of electrodes has profound influence in electrochemical performance. If a novel design of the electrode can be constructed by the V2O5 active materials with hierarchical morphology, the
aligned hierarchical structure from both micro- and nano-scale will probably offer excellent capacity and cyclic performance. The structure resembling ultrafine and well-organized morphology of metamaterials[246–249] may provide sufficient space to enhance the electron transport and the current collection, and thus improve the ability to buffer the cyclic volume changes.
As discussed in the previous sections, experimental approaches have been widely used to synthesize the V2O5 and V2O5-based composite micro- or nano-materials as the LIB electrodes. For future development in fabricating advanced electrodes, there are two perspectives related to the synthesis routes that can be suggested. First, the method of hydrothermal or solvothermal routes may have potential to be improved. In recent years, the participation of the microwave radiation has been believed to be beneficial to the preparation. This will improve the reaction rate and reduce the energy consumption.[250,251] Simple radiation-based methods such as microwave and ultraviolet are quick and clean and heating inside the solution is more uniform than otherwise. Those could lead to the formation of novel nanostructure or morphology of the as-synthesized material structures. Second, the usage of the innovative current collectors is another significant pathway to facilitate the electrode to reach better performance. Some hierarchical, porous, and light-weight conductive materials such as aluminum foils,[252–254] nickel foams,[255] carbon nanotube sponges,[256,257] and graphite foams[76] are competitive candidates as current collectors. The properties of the excellent electrical conductivity and the improved surface area of those current collectors are expected to enhance the electrochemical reactivity.
The mechanical durability of materials used for the LIB electrode is inevitable for any applications.[42,258,259] The mechanical durability of V2O5 electrode materials mainly includes the maintenance of the initial structure under the extreme condition such as at the elevated temperature and pressure as well as frequent volume changes. To date, some simulation and calculation using the first-principles have revealed the negative effect of fracture in electrodes. The brittleness was observed under high-rate charging/discharging related mechanical and electrochemical interaction.[260–262,263] New design in the nanostructure of V2O5 for an electrode is necessary in order to improve the mechanical durability by eliminating volume change and phase transformation. The hierarchical micro- or nano-structures such as the hollow micro-sphere[58,263–265] or micro-polyhedrons,[266] yolk-shell embedded structures,[267–269] and highly porous interconnected networks[244,245,270,271] are desirable to prevent such fracture. Furthermore, some advanced experimental techniques may need to be deployed for the characterization of the mechanical properties of electrodes. Considers are, for example, the tensile test of nanowires,[272] the nanoindentation of nanocomposites,[273] and the mechanical test during the lithium ion intercalation/deintercalation reactions to characterize the mechanical properties of newly formed phases using in situ and environmental TEM.[274]
In order to achieve the optimized electrochemical performance, the consideration of multi-factors of novel electrodes is necessary during design, fabrication, and assembly of the V2O5 and V2O5-based composite electrodes. A representative example is the combination of the addition of the carbonaceous materials and the hierarchical design of the microstructure.
www.advenergymat.de
© 2017 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim1602545 (28 of 32)
www.advancedsciencenews.com
Adv. Energy Mater. 2017, 7, 1602545
According to this review, the addition of carbonaceous materials could enhance the electrical conductivity and the structural stability. Due to their small dimension, the dispersion of carbonaceous additives only improves the electrical conductivity and the structural stability locally. The large-scale and long-range spatial design such as the addition of the hierarchical microstructures would promote better performance. In recent years, several researchers have applied hierarchical core shell structures to the fabrication of the novel V2O5 or V2O5-based composite electrodes.[256,275–277] The combination of multiple preferred factors has considerable advantage deserving further exploration.
The electrochemical energy storage devices such as sodiumion[30] and magnesium-ion[34] batteries are other competitive candidates because of their abundant reservation, lower price, and similar redox potential (Li+/Li: E° = −3.04 V;[30] Na+/Na: E° = −2.71 V;[32] Mg2+/Mg: E° = −2.37 V[34]). Due to the unique layered crystalline morphology of V2O5, it has been considered as the cathode material for sodium- and magnesium-ion batteries for several decades.[33,34] Several reports have provided convincing results about the usage of V2O5 and V2O5-based composite nanomaterials for sodium-[278,279] and magnesiumion batteries.[280,281] However, the insertion modes of the sodium and magnesium ions (up to 1.6[32] and 2[282]) into the interlayered spaces of V2O5 are fewer than that of lithium ions (up to 3). Those issues remain to be challenging for the application of V2O5 and V2O5-based composite electrodes to sodiumand magnesium-ion batteries. Recommendation lies in creating the novel micro- and nano-structures, utilization of the core– shell hierarchical morphology, addition of the conductive components, and the design of the innovative current collectors.
In summary, the application of the V2O5 and V2O5-based composite electrodes is being widened due to increasing demands. For further advancement, efforts are needed to enable mass production of electrodes with higher specific capacity, longer lifespan, increased capacity retention, reliable rate performance, enhanced mechanical and thermal stability, lower fabrication cost, and acceptable environmental compatibility.

metadata.abstractText: DOI: 10.1002/aenm.201602545 deficiency. The exclusive research and industrial focus on the development of new energy sources cannot meet the current energy demands. The main reason is lack of efficient storage of the collected energy. Because the consumption rate of generated energy usually cannot be synchronized with the rate of generation. Fortunately, this problem has received attention from researchers and engineers around the world. Electrochemical energy storage devices (EESDs)[1,2] are competitive candidates for energy storage. Lithiumion batteries (LIBs),[3–11] electron double layer capacitors (EDLCs) as well as pseudocapacitors (PCs),[12–17] lithium–sulfur (Li–S) batteries,[18–22] lithium–air (Li–air) or lithium–oxygen (Li–O2) batteries,[23–29] sodium-ion batteries,[30–33] magnesium-ion batteries,[34] lithium solid state batteries,[35] among others are currently popular EESDs. Among those devices, lithium-ion batteries are of great interest. Since being initially commercialized by Sony, Inc. in 1990,[36] for more than a quarter of a century, the lithium-ion battery has become a popular, portable, and rechargeable second battery used in various applications such as personal electronic devices,[37] electric vehicles,[38] hybrid electric vehicles,[39] and smart grids.[40] To date, it is still needed to further improve the electrochemical performance of lithium-ion batteries. The fabrication of novel and reliable electrode materials is critical for further development of better lithium-ion batteries. A lithium-ion battery cell usually includes components of a solid-state positive electrode (cathode), a solid-state negative electrode (anode), some lithium-ion included liquidstate electrolyte (can be either non-aqueous or aqueous[41]), a polymeric separator, and a pair of the current collectors with encapsulated cases.[3] If an external voltage applied to both electrodes, lithium ions are deintercalated from cathode to anode through the electrolyte, so called the charging process; when there is an external loading applied to both electrodes, lithium ions are intercalated into unlithiated cathode from lithiated anode through the electrolyte again, i.e., the discharging process.[3,39,42] The discharging procedure of a LIB cell is shown in Figure 1.[39] The role of the porous separator is to prevent the short circuit inside a cell. As the most significant components of one lithium-ion battery cell, the properties of both cathode and anode materials determine the electrochemical energy storage ability of the cell. Therefore, the selection of Vanadium pentoxide (V2O5) has played important roles in lithium-ion batteries due to its unique crystalline structure. To assist researchers understanding the roles this material plays, a comprehensive and critical review is conducted based on about 250 publications. Here, we report basics and applications of microand nano-materials of V2O5 and V2O5-based composites. The comparative and statistical analysis leads to the discovery of several interesting phenomena. The V2O5 electrodes with two lithium ions have a favorable capacity performance with reversible phase formation. The excellent capacity retention is displayed in the V2O5 electrodes with one lithium ion inserted. In the case of three lithium ions insertion, it was found that the irreversible formation of the phase ω in LixV2O5 leads to its control. In addition, effects of additives on electrode performance, circuitry models of performance, as well as reaction routes are studied. Two unprecedented concepts of the “high capacity band” and “empirical total capacity retention” are proposed though the comprehensive statistical analysis of the reviewed data. This review provides a comprehensive collection of information of state-ofthe-art and recent advancement in V2O5 and V2O5-based composite materials for electrodes. Researchers could use the information to design and develop advanced electrodes for future batteries. Lithium-Ion Batteries
